Description.Html: Travel agents book and plan business and leisure travel for customers.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It may help if you have customer service experience and can speak a second language.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in travel from the Institute of Travel & Tourism and Careers that Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience, there may be opportunities to progress into senior roles like:

  • branch or call centre manager
  • operations director
  • regional director
  • managing director

You could also move into other roles in the travel sector, like tour operating.

Description.Html: Tree surgeons carry out tree work including planting, felling, care and maintenance, and hazard assessments.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the The Arboricultrual Association for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working with trees through The Arboricultural Association and the Royal Forestry Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With qualifications and experience, you could progress to supervisor or manager. You could also start your own business.

You could move into recreational tree climbing, taking people into treetops as an outdoor activity.

ContentItemIds: «c#: await Content.GetContentItemIdByDisplayText("Occupation", "assistant video and motion picture director")»

Description.Html: Assistant directors support directors by organising and planning everything on TV or film sets.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It's important to get practical experience of the production process. You'll also need a network of contacts in the industry to help you find work.

You may find it useful to train in health and safety, as this is likely to be part of your duties.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in film and TV from ScreenSkills.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to be a director, production manager or producer.

Description.Html: Camera operators record images for film, television, commercials and online.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about how to become a camera operator from ScreenSkills.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a camera supervisor, cinematographer or director of photography.

You could specialise in a particular field, like underwater filming, aerial photography or wildlife work.

Description.Html: TV and film directors lead the creative and technical production for cinema and television.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A network of industry contacts will be extremely useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find more details about directing in film and TV through ScreenSkills.

Shooting People has information, resources and networks for independent film-makers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you might develop your own projects and raise the money to put them into production.

Description.Html: TV and film producers look after the business side of productions.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Production Guild, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a lot of experience in both the creative and business sides of film or programme making. You'll also need an in-depth understanding of the production process, and a good network of contacts in the industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a TV or film producer from ScreenSkills and ProductionBase.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become an executive producer, or set up your own production company.

Description.Html: Production assistants support producers in making film or TV programmes.

HtbBodies.Html:
You could join the The Production Guild for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

You can find out more about entry level opportunities in television from the Royal Television Society

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to develop experience in both the creative and business sides of film or programme making. You'll also need to develop an understanding of the production process, and a good network of contacts in the industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a TV or film production assistant from ScreenSkills and ProductionBase.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to production coordinator and production manager, or become a researcher or producer.

Description.Html: Production managers take care of the business, financial and recruitment side of film and television productions.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Production Guild for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it helpful to have accounting skills and qualifications because of the budget management work involved with this job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in production management from ScreenSkills and ProductionBase.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work on freelance contracts for television broadcasters or independent production companies and negotiate better fees based on your experience and reputation.

You could open your own studio or move into working as an executive producer, where you'll be responsible for several productions at once.

Description.Html: Sound technicians are responsible for recording the voices and background noise on TV and film shoots.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers and training in sound for TV and film from ScreenSkills and the BBC Academy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could progress from working for a small, regional company or station to working for a large, national one. You could also move into studio management.

Description.Html: TV presenters introduce and host programmes, interview people and report on issues and events.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Some broadcasters hold competitions to find new presenters.

You'll usually need a showreel, with clips of yourself on camera, to give to broadcasters, producers or media recruitment agencies.

Competition is strong, so you'll need determination, persistence and the ability to promote yourself.

Jobs are not always advertised, so you need to make industry contacts to find out who is hiring.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about working in presenting through ScreenSkills and the Broadcast Journalism Training Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With an established TV career, you could branch out into radio work, acting or writing for newspapers and magazines.

With experience, you could also choose to move into other areas within the media industry like production.

Description.Html: Typists use a computer to produce letters, reports and other documents.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training, you could become a secretary, personal assistant or office manager.

You could also become self-employed.

Description.Html: Upholsterers pad, cover and re-cover furniture with materials like leather, suede or cotton.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in upholstery from Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a supervisory or management position.

You could specialise in re-upholstering antique furniture or work in interior design. You could also become self-employed.

Description.Html: UX designers use research to understand their users and create websites, applications and software to meet their needs.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You'll find it useful to have:

  • knowledge of development tools like HTML and CSS
  • experience of using design software like Adobe Creative Suite
  • experience of creating wireframes and prototypes by hand and with software
  • an understanding of agile project development methods

It'll help if you have a portfolio to showcase examples of your work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a user experience (UX) designer fromUser Experience Professionals' Association; Creative Choices; Tech Future Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into a management job and supervise other designers.

You could also move into a development role if you've got experience of programming languages.

Description.Html: User researchers collect, analyse and test data to design websites, software and applications based on user needs.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It will be useful if you have experience of working in agile project development.

It will also help if you have a portfolio to show examples of your work to employers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a user researcher from the User Experience Professionals' Association and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into a management role and supervise a team of user researchers. You could also work on larger, more complicated projects as a head of user experience or research.

You could also move into a business analyst or product design role.

Description.Html: Vehicle body repairers mend damaged vehicle parts and bodywork using metalworking and finishing techniques.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in vehicle accident repair from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a lead fitter or technician, or move into supervisory and body-shop management positions in larger firms. You could also work as a vehicle damage assessor for a repair workshop or an insurance firm.

You could also set up your own business and move into mobile repair.

Description.Html: Vending machine operators fill, maintain and collect money from machines that dispense products like drinks and snacks.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Automatic Vending Association, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about the vending industry from the Automatic Vending Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a supervisor or area manager, or set up your own vending business.

Description.Html: Vets diagnose and treat sick or injured animals.

HtbBodies.Html:
You could join the British Veterinary Association and British Small Animals Veterinary Association for professional development and networking opportunities.

You could join the British Equine Veterinary Association if you work with horses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a vet from the [Royal College of Veterinary Surgeons | https://animalowners.rcvs.org.uk/veterinary-careers/] and British Veterinary Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could focus on treating particular animals, or specialise in areas such as dermatology or cardiology, by taking RCVS-approved postgraduate courses.

Experience in veterinary surgery could also help you to get a job in environmental conservation.

You could also move into a career in research and teaching with a university or research body.

Description.Html: Veterinary nurses support vets by caring for sick and injured animals.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Veterinary Nursing Association for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a veterinary nurse from the British Veterinary Nursing Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could take on more responsibility, like practice management, supervising and training new staff, or working in veterinary supplies.

You could also train to specialise in working for a zoological/wildlife park, charity, pharmaceutical company or breeding/boarding kennels.

With further study you could work towards becoming a lecturer or researcher.

Description.Html: Veterinary physiotherapists work with injured animals, or animals with movement problems, to help reduce pain and improve their health.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Association of Chartered Physiotherapists in Animal Therapy for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a veterinary physiotherapist from:The Association of Chartered Physiotherapists in Animal Therapy; National Association of Veterinary Physiotherapists; The Institute of Registered Veterinary and Animal Physiotherapists

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior physiotherapist, or a specialist physiotherapist for breathing conditions or problems affecting the nervous system.

You could also set up your own animal physiotherapy practice or move into research.

Description.Html: Victim care officers support people who've been affected by crime.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about this career from Victim Support.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior victim care officer, unit or area manager, with responsibilities for a number of centres, staff and volunteers.

You could also move into witness care, with a greater focus on the legal and judicial system and making sure witnesses attend court.

Description.Html: Video editors bring together images and sound for use in film, TV and online productions.

HtbCareerTips.Html: As you get experience, you could make a 'showreel' DVD or online profile of productions you've worked on to demonstrate your skills to employers when looking for work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in editing from ScreenSkills.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Once established, you might use an agent to find work and negotiate your fees.

You could set up your own company.

Description.Html: Visitor attraction general managers look after the operation and finances of an attraction, and the health and safety of staff and visitors.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a visitor attraction general manager from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to senior roles like divisional, regional or group director.

Description.Html: Visual merchandisers design eye-catching product displays and store layouts to encourage sales.

HtbBodies.Html: You could become a member of the British Display Society for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in visual merchandising from Creative Choices and the Fashion Retail Academy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader, then visual merchandising manager.

You could also move into retail, exhibition or interior design, or set up your own business creating one-off displays.

Description.Html: Vloggers create videos about their life or special interests and add them to their social media channels.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Institute of Direct and Digital Marketing for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can get advice and tips online from other vloggers who have recently started up.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about vlogging and media marketing from ScreenSkills and icould.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could work for a retail, fashion or marketing company, managing a team of freelance vloggers or social media influencers.

Description.Html: Waiters serve food and drinks to customers in restaurants and cafes, take orders and handle payments.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working as a waiter from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you may be able to progress to head waiter or waitress, or restaurant supervisor.

You may also be able to go into related areas of work like restaurant and kitchen management or purchasing.

Description.Html: Wardrobe assistants help to make, find and look after clothes and costumes used in theatre, film and TV productions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about how to become a wardrobe assistant through Creative Choices.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You’ll specialise in either theatre work, film or TV, but you could cross over between areas once established.

With experience, you could become a wardrobe manager or move into set design, production design or stage management.

Description.Html: Warehouse managers plan and co-ordinate warehouse operations at distribution depots, retail superstores and manufacturing plants.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may have an advantage when looking for work if you've done forklift training.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in warehousing from Skills for Logistics.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could be promoted to regional or national operations manager or director.

Description.Html: Warehouse workers take delivery of goods and pack orders for dispatch.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in warehousing from The Chartered Institute for Logistics and Transport.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a team leader, shift supervisor or warehouse manager.

You could also move into quality control, freight planning or distribution.

Description.Html: Clock and watch repairers mend and restore clocks and watches.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Horological Institute and The Worshipful Company of Clockmakers for training opportunities and professional development.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about watchmaking careers from the British Horological Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could manage a workshop or retail jewellery outlet, or run your own business repairing or designing watches.

If you specialise in antique clocks, you could work in a museum conserving antique clocks, or work at an auctioneers as a valuer.

Description.Html: Water network operatives look after the pipes, mains and pumping stations that supply homes and businesses with water.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about working and training in the water industry from Talent Source Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to a team leader.

With further training, you could become an engineering technician or water engineer.

Description.Html: Water quality technicians treat and clean drinking water and process waste water.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about careers and training in the water industry through Talent Source Network.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a team leader. With further training, you could become an engineering technician or a water engineer.

Description.Html: Web content editors research, write and manage an organisation’s online content, including text, images, video and other media.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working in web content from Tech Future Careers and the Society for Editors and Proofreaders.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into editorial team management or general information management roles.

You could also work on a freelance basis, and set up your own business.

With further training, you may have the option to move into related areas, like website development, design or training.

Description.Html: Web content managers are responsible for the information that goes on an organisation's website.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice on working in web content from:Tech Future Careers; Society for Editors and Proofreaders; National Council for the Training of Journalists

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could progress into information management, search engine optimisation (SEO), technical web development or wider information planning and policy roles.

Description.Html: Web designers use their creative and technical skills to design new websites and redesign existing ones.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You'll need a portfolio of work that shows employers your creative design skills.

Make sure that you're up to date with the latest trends, features and design software by:

  • getting involved in free webinars or online training courses
  • signing up to free online magazines
  • reading the latest industry blogs for news and tips

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in web design from Creative Choices and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into design team management or expand your skills to become a web content manager.

You might work towards a move into business management.

You could also work as a freelance web designer, or set up your own web design business.

Description.Html: Web developers create and maintain websites and web applications.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Make sure that you're up to date with the latest industry trends and web development standards.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in computing from Tech Future Careers and The Chartered Institute for IT.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular area, like e-commerce or move up to a more senior role like lead programmer or project leader.

You could also move into other IT fields, like systems analysis or IT project management.

Description.Html: Wedding planners help couples organise their wedding.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Many wedding planners have their own blog or website to showcase their work, personality and style.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a wedding planner from:UK Alliance of Wedding Planners; National Association of Professional Wedding Services; Wedding Planners Guild UK

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could set up your own wedding planning consultancy or event management company.

Description.Html: Welders join, cut and shape sections of metal plate, pipework and composite materials in different industries.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Welding Institute for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about welding careers through the Engineering and Construction Industry Training Board and The Welding Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could be promoted to a supervisory role or be a workshop manager.

You could also work in welding inspection, testing and quality control or, with commercial diver training, underwater welding.

Description.Html: Welfare rights officers give support and free advice to the public.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
A qualification in counselling, legal work or advice and guidance could be useful, though your employer may give you on-the-job training.

The ability to speak a second language or a qualification in British Sign Language could be helpful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in welfare rights from Citizens Advice and AdviceUK.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into specialist advice and casework, or be promoted to a team leader or management post.

Description.Html: Wind turbine technicians maintain and repair wind farm turbines on land and at sea.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Demand for wind turbine technicians is predicted to grow over the next 10 years, with older wind farms being replaced or refurbished, as they come to the end of their working lives.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can discover more about a career as a wind turbine technician from RenewableUK.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become an authorised technician, with responsibility for supervising a technical team, and dealing with health and safety.

With further training, you could work as an operations and maintenance manager, control systems engineer or energy engineer.

Description.Html: Window cleaners work on domestic and commercial premises, cleaning windows, doors and other glass surfaces.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Federation of Window Cleaners for professional development training and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Employers will be interested in your practical skills, ability to work at height, and your awareness of health and safety regulations and good practice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work for contract cleaners or specialist window cleaning firms. With experience, you may be able to progress to become a supervisor or manager.

You may start your own business, working alone or employing staff.

Description.Html: Window fitters install windows, conservatories and glazed curtain walls in homes and businesses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a window fitter or glazier from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a window surveyor or estimator, or move into glazing sales and marketing.

You could set up your own business or take up a window fitting franchise.

Description.Html: Windscreen fitters repair and replace damaged glass on vehicles like cars, lorries and buses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the car industry from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With more training you could become a vehicle mechanic, breakdown engineer or workshop supervisor.

You could also start your own windscreen repair company.

Description.Html: Wine merchants find new wines and buy and market them.

HtbCareerTips.Html: The ability to speak French, Spanish, Portuguese, German or Italian might be useful for working with overseas wine exporters.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about working in wine retail through the Wine & Spirit Education Trust.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become an independent wine merchant. You’ll need funds and a well-researched business plan.

You could also progress to become a Master of Wine (MW). This is the British wine trader’s highest qualification.

Description.Html: Wood machinists cut and prepare timber for use in wood products.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about how to become a wood machinist from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to a supervisor role, or move into related work like bench joinery, shopfitting or kitchen and bathroom installation.

Description.Html: Writers produce creative work, including novels, children's books, scripts, poetry and travel and technical writing.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You'll need:

  • creative ideas that will sell
  • good research skills
  • the ability to express ideas in a style suited to your intended audience

You'll also need to have confidence in your writing, be able to accept criticism and remain positive.

You'll need a portfolio of your work to show to employers and commissioning editors.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find more advice about careers in writing through Creative Choices and the National Association of Writers' Groups.

The Poetry Society and Writers & Artists have more details on writing competitions.

Writers & Artists also has industry advice on being a writer and submitting work for publishing or self-publishing. It publishes the Writers’ and Artists’ Yearbook, which has information on literary agents, publishers, newspapers and magazines.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could self-publish, in traditional print format, online or through e-books.

You might be able to promote your work by entering literary competitions, become a book critic or teach creative writing in colleges.

Description.Html: Yard people load and unload deliveries and re-order stocks at factory warehouses, building suppliers and retail distribution companies.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about yard work and trade supplies from Building Materials Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a yard or warehouse supervisor, or yard manager.

You could move into delivery driving, forklift work or product sales.

Description.Html: Yoga teachers teach yoga as a form of exercise to increase fitness and wellbeing.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join organisations like the The British Wheel of Yoga or Iyengar Yoga UK for professional development and to make contacts with other teachers.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll usually need 2 years' experience of practising yoga with a qualified teacher to teach it yourself.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could run your own yoga workshops, yoga retreats, or holidays.

You may be able to train as a yoga therapist or take further qualifications to train yoga teachers.

Description.Html: Yoga therapists use yoga to help people with physical issues, emotional issues or specific health problems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in yoga from the British Council for Yoga Therapy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could teach yoga, as well as practising as a self-employed therapist.

Description.Html: Youth offending team officers work to prevent children and young people under 18 from offending and reoffending.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about working with young people, training and volunteering through the Youth Justice Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader or team manager.

With further training you could move into social work or educational welfare.

Description.Html: Youth workers guide and support young people aged 11 to 25. They organise activities to help with personal and social development.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice on careers and training in youth work from the National Youth Agency.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could take on a more specialist role in an area like mental health. You could also become a team leader or manager.

Other options are to gain further qualifications and move into social work, teaching, community development or counselling.

Description.Html: Zookeepers look after animals in zoos, safari parks and aquariums.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in zoos from the British and Irish Association of Zoos and Aquariums.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
In larger zoos, wildlife parks or aquariums, you could progress from keeper to team leader or head keeper. With experience and a degree, you could become a curator.

You could also move into education or conservation research.

Description.Html: Zoologists study animals and their behaviour.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers and training in zoology from the Institute of Zoology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into other jobs like management, marketing, sales, scientific journalism or consultancy.

You could also work and study overseas.
